title: Introductory R Hands-On Workshop
description:
Introductory Hands-On Workshop

We are offering a Hands-On Workshop for all R beginner members. Laptops are required. The tentative agenda includes:

-Installation / Setup of R, RStudio and Github

-Introduction to R

-Some basic exercises

title: R-Ladies Miami Launch Event
description:
Dear R-Ladies Miami members!

We are glad to announce our Launch event! We hope you‚Äôll be able to join us to meet other R-Ladies members, learn more about the this international network and share more about yourself and your R goals. Since it‚Äôll be the first time many of us meet, we‚Äôd like to keep it casual and, together, define the course of the Meetups to come! No laptops are required as there will be no coding - this time. Do not forget to fill out our member-survey:

https://goo.gl/forms/aQDNndKmkl5Kl6Jp2

Tentative Agenda

6:30PM: Networking // Food (Sponsored by Sherlock Talent (http://www.sherlocktalent.com/))

7:00PM: Introduction & Community Open Dialogue

‚Ä¢ Intro

‚Ä¢ Ice breaker

‚Ä¢ Open Dialogue

8:00PM: Networking // Drinks (Wynwood Brewing Company (https://www.yelp.com/biz/wynwood-brewing-company-miami))

We are looking forward to meeting you!

Your R-Ladies Miami Org-team

title: Handling missing data using R
description:
‚Ä¢ What we'll do
Mine Dogucu will be here from out of town and will be our guest speaker! She'll give a talk on Handling Missing Values with R. Whether you are an experienced R user or are just getting started, we invite you to come out!

Bio: Mine Dogucu completed her PhD at the Ohio State University. During her graduate studies she founded R Ladies Columbus. In August 2017, she joined the Data Science Program at New College of Florida as Assistant Professor of Applied Statistics. She has been teaching statistics courses both at the undergraduate and graduate levels. She also has founded R Ladies Sarasota.

Talk Abstract: It is common for data scientists and researchers to encounter missing data. The term ‚Äúmissing‚Äù often has a bad connotation and is usually considered a nuisance. Advances in missing data treatments such as multiple imputation and maximum likelihood procedures allow data analysts to obtain unbiased parameter estimates under certain circumstances. This talk will introduce missing data terminology and ways of handling missing data using R.

‚Ä¢ What to bring

‚Ä¢ Important to know

title: Women in Data Science Conference - Miami
description:
** NOTE: Tickets for this event are found at www.miamiwids.com. Must register there for tickets. **

ABOUT THE EVENT

The Global Women in Data Science (WiDS) Conference aims to inspire and educate data scientists worldwide, regardless of gender, and support women in the field. This annual conference is held at Stanford University and 100+ locations worldwide, hosted by WiDS Ambassadors.

This one-day technical conference provides an opportunity to hear about the latest data science-related research in a number of domains, learn how leading-edge companies are leveraging data science for success, and connect with potential mentors, collaborators, and others in the field. All genders are invited to participate in the conference, which features exclusively female speakers.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND

The conference is open to everyone, regardless of gender, who is interested in engaging with and learning from the local data science community.

WHAT TO EXPECT

‚Ä¢ Live data science workshop in Python

‚Ä¢ Talks from local speakers from academia and the industry

‚Ä¢ Opportunity to network with the local data science community and leadership, potential partners, employers and employees

‚Ä¢ Livestream of Stanford Keynote Speakers

title: Holiday Celebration! üëë
description:
This year, R-Ladies Miami is partnering up with two of the biggest data science Meetup groups, Data Science Study Group South Florida and Data Science Meetup, to celebrate our community and its growth with an end of the year celebration. It will be held on Tuesday, December 17, 2019. We will reflect on the highlights of the year, talk about what bigger and better things we have in store for 2020 and introduce a civic, community wide project. We also have a very special guest planned üòâ

If you're in the data science community, this is the event you don't want to miss and we'd love for you to be a part of this joyous event

title: Text Mining Scientific Papers with R!
description:
This month we are excited to give the floor to a fellow R-Lady, Roc√≠o Joo!
Roc√≠o Joo, a movement statistician, is a postdoctoral research associate at the University of Florida (Fort Lauderdale Research and Education Center in Davie). She started my coding life in Matlab and slowly transitioned to R.

Roc√≠o will present a procedure to text mine scientific articles using an
example of a field of science, movement ecology. She will briefly address identification of the papers of interest, execute and discuss code for downloading articles, extracting the text and perform data analysis (topic modeling and wordclouds).

Look forward to seeing you there! Please be sure to bring your laptops and as usual, refreshments will be provided! ;)

title: Accelerated Design Thinking Sprint Workshop
description:
We're back on ;)

This month's meeting will be Design Thinking Sprint workshop sponsored by R-Ladies and Google's Women Techmakers! It is intended to be a continuation of Laura's talk on Design Thinking back in June.

‚ÄòDesign sprint‚Äô is a methodological process which is primarily based on design thinking (a principle founded by a former Googler, Jake Knapp) , it helps you to see beyond the problem and you learn to solve the problems in the most efficient way within a specific time range. It is applicable to anyone in the Data Science/Tech community. The main focus will be more on cultivating mindset and skills rather than on tools.

This workshop will be based on the book "Sprint" by Jake Knapp, John Zeratsky, et al. (https://www.amazon.com/Sprint-Solve-Problems-Test-Ideas/dp/150112174X/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=sprint&qid=1565275020&s=gateway&sr=8-1)

This workshop is not exclusive to those in the R community. Anyone is the tech,data science community, or just want to learn about a new approach to solving problems is welcome to join! Lunch will be provided. :)

Parking:
Cultural Center Garage:
50 NW 2nd Ave.
Miami, FL 33126

$5 flat rate with validation inside the library!

title: DevFest Miami 2019
description:
DevFest, organized by different Google Developers Groups (GDG) across the country, are community-run events that offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas, hack-a-thons, codelabs, and more. It is an opportunity for members of the tech community to gather, learn, network, and grow from each other. It will also be a great event to meet new people.

Women Techmakers, as a sponsor of DevFest is excited to give an awesome workshop aimed at encouraging women and underrepresented groups to celebrate their achievements!

This event is sponsored by Google and Googles' Women Techmakers. It is hosted in collaboration with GDG Cloud Miami (https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Cloud-Miami/events/jnxfgryzmblc/)

title: Text data analysis using R!
description:
Come join us on Tuesday July 23rd as we learn about text analytics using R. Specifically, our speaker, Gracie, will discuss Principal Component Analysis and Hierarchical Analysis on text data.

About the speaker: Gracie Diaz is a data scientist on the AI and Robotics team at Royal Caribbean. Her work has focused on machine learning techniques related to Natural Language Processing (NLP), from which she is co-inventor on two pending patents. Her background includes security operations at Royal as well as investment and banking roles at Deutsche Bank and Lehman Brothers. She received her B.A. in Applied Mathematics from Johns Hopkins University. Outside of professional pursuits, she particularly enjoys being silly with her husband, her kids, and their dog.

title: Data Science + Design Thinking : A powerful combination
description:
Data science methodologies such as CRISP or KDD are used as standard processes for quantitative analysis, providing a structured procedure for handling large and diverse data sets. However, these methodologies can be improved upon. This presentation proposes a hybrid methodology for combining elements from qualitative research (such as personas) in order to improve statistical analysis and provide a deeper understanding into problem setting, using example scenarios from the financial industry.

In this talk we will ...
- Reflect on the current standardized methodologies used for quantitative research methods (aka statistics/data science) like CRISP / KDD and how they perform in real life
- Analyze how to embed elements from qualitative research methods to enhance the data science process
- Set the seed for the need of a new methodology
- Open up for ideas/questions

About the Speaker:

Laura Gabrysiak is a Data Scientist at Visa where she develops statistical models and user-friendly decision analytics tools to help customers get the most out of their data. She is the co-founder of R-Ladies Miami, a worldwide organization for promoting diversity in the R community with more than 100 chapters in 35+ countries. She likes to mentor and shares her knowledge through mentorship programs, tutorials and talks.

She has 6 years of professional experience in Business Analytics and User Research in both academia and industry. She has worked with several startups where she helped building teams, developed business analytics strategy and implemented statistical models to gather user intelligence with help of techniques from design thinking. Education: Msc. Information Systems - dschool HPI Alumni.

Admission: Free!

Parking: TheVentureCity has a rear lot with free parking, accessible via 9th St. Otherwise, you may use metered parking on 8th St.

title: Data Analysis in R Continued!
description:
Hi R-Ladies!

Join us for our May meetup at the CIC Miami. We'll have Kimoy Kotun teach us some data wrangling techniques using the data.table and dplyr packages.

Kimoy currently works as a Data Specialist at Spirit Airlines. She holds hold an undergraduate and Masters degree in Mathematics. Kimoy started her career in the Revenue Management Group at Spirit and, within the last year and a half, developed a keen interest in the Data Science space as she saw this as an opportunity to hone in and grow her statistical expertise and programming skills. She is a self-taught R user and now uses R on a daily basis in my current role, primarily for reporting and data analysis. Kimoy enjoy reading and learning more about Data Science as it is a constantly evolving field.

We looking forward to seeing you there!

title: Joined Meetup with DSSG:SoFlo - Big Data with R in the Cloud
description:
Hello Ladies! We will not be having a Meetup this month. However, our partner in community based R learning, The Data Science Study Group: South Florida, will be having a Meetup on April 24 where a speaker from Microsoft will be giving a talk on Big Data with R in the Cloud. I think this will be a VERY interesting and beneficial talk and those who can attend should! Go and rep R-Ladies! üí™üèºüë∏
Here is the link to that Meetup for more info: http://meetu.ps/e/Gm8n8/HMjRK/d

venues.name: The Idea Center, MDC Wolfson Campus

title: Version Control and Workflow in RStudio
description:
Hi everyone! üëãüèº Based on the feedback from our happy hour last month, it appears that people prefer a project based approach to learning. R-Lady Laurel has kindly allowed us to use her data from The National Gallery of Art to investigate issues in provenance. This first workshop will be aimed at setting up Git & GitHub, connect them to RStudio, and important things to consider to have a efficient workflow and easier collaboration with others.

Please bring your own laptop as this will be hands-on.

Let me know if you have any questions!

Oh, wine and cheese will be provided! üç∑üíÉ

Tentative schedule:
- 5:30 networking and drinks
- 6:00 workshop

title: Women in Data Science Conference - Miami
description:
** NOTE: Tickets for this event are found at www.miamiwids.com/register . Must register there for tickets. **

ABOUT THE EVENT

The Global Women in Data Science (WiDS) Conference aims to inspire and educate data scientists worldwide, regardless of gender, and support women in the field. This annual conference is held at Stanford University and 100+ locations worldwide, hosted by WiDS Ambassadors.

This one-day technical conference provides an opportunity to hear about the latest data science-related research in a number of domains, learn how leading-edge companies are leveraging data science for success, and connect with potential mentors, collaborators, and others in the field. All genders are invited to participate in the conference, which features exclusively female speakers.

WHO SHOULD ATTEND

The conference is open to everyone, regardless of gender, who is interested in engaging with and learning from the local data science community.

Whether you are an experienced data scientist or looking to learn more about the field, WiDS Miami will have great content and opportunities to connect.

WHAT TO EXPECT

‚Ä¢ Talks from local leaders in the industry

‚Ä¢ Opportunity to network with the local data science community and leadership, potential partners, employers and employees

‚Ä¢ Livestream of Stanford Keynote Speakers

Light breakfast and lunch will be served.

title: R-Ladies Miami 2019 Kickoff Happy Hour!
description:
Hello R-Ladies! I know it's late, but happy new year! I want to start off the year with a social that way we can all get re-acquainted, talk, bounce ideas for topics off one another, and most importantly, have a little "wine down" after a busy work day, amiright? ü§∑ If you already have suggestions, feel free to comment here but I'd love a chance to meet other data-driven r lovers like myself!
The bar is fairly new but really quaint and has a food truck and an outdoor patio which, if the weather's nice, will be perfect for us. Parking is street only.
Hope to see you there!

title: Using deep neural nets to learn similarity in product design
description:
Title: I know your aesthetic: Using deep neural nets to learn similarity in product design

Sreya Ghosh, is a data-scientist at Shopify, building methods to improve e-commerce algorithms. She has worked for Wayfair, Restaurant Brands International and Tapjoy across many topics in Data-Science. She has her PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering, where she focused on building advanced methods for microscopy. Her proudest accomplishment remains the chili cook-off she won at work and she is willing to share the recipe on a need to know basis.

title: pmlbr and treeheatr: visualizing decision trees on benchmark datasets
description:
The presentation of the decision tree with data represented as a heatmap is a new visualization that uncovers the tree's performance, the data's correlation structure, and the importance of each feature in predicting the outcome. Implemented in an easily installed package with a detailed vignette, treeheatr can be a useful teaching tool to enhance students‚Äô understanding of a simple decision tree model before diving into more complex tree-based machine learning methods.

Trang is a postdoctoral fellow with Jason Moore at the Computational Genetics Lab, University of Pennsylvania. She enjoys developing machine learning methods for analyses of biomedical data, including neuroimage (functional/structural MRI), transcriptomics and genotypes. Most of the datasets she works with are high dimensional (i.e., have many predictors/features), so she spends most of her time building feature selection algorithms for these data. She trades her bias toward the nearest-neighbor concept for lower variance of her methods and better generalizability. When she is not knee deep in data, she runs, dance and seasonally skis.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~MATERIALS~~~~~~~~~
slides: https://slides.com/trang1618/treeheatr-pmlbr
material doc: https://slides.com/trang1618/treeheatr-pmlbr

title: #IamRemarkable Week!
description:
Join us for this engaging and powerful workshop!

#IamRemarkable is a Google initiative empowering women and other underrepresented groups to celebrate their achievements in the workplace and beyond. Learn more --> https://iamremarkable.withgoogle.com/

Housekeeping: Please be mindful when RSVPing. We give individualized attention to all participants in the workshop so if you know you cannot make it, please update your RSVP to give another a chance to attend.

Facilitators:
*Layla Bouzoubaa - Miami, FL*
Layla Bouzoubaa is a Lead Research Analyst for the University of Miami (UM) Miller School of Medicine's Department of Public Health Sciences (DPHS). She focuses on substance abuse research which targets interventions to patients suffering from opioid addiction - which includes developing web apps for resource mapping, data harmonization, and population statistics/visualizations to building models that will inform proper treatment. Layla also has the pleasure in co-instructing "Data Science for Biostatistics", a 6-week summer course for masters and PhD level students within DPHS.

*Monica Longoria - Atlanta, GA*
Monica has spent her career supporting sales account executives with data, best practices, and training. As a Career Coach, she teaches others how to use those same sales tactics to further their own careers.

title: Digital phenotyping, artificial intelligence and mental health
description:
This talk will focus on the emerging intersection of artificial intelligence, digital phenotyping, and mental health. Dr. Omar C. will discuss research opportunities and challenges in diagnosis and clinically validated mental health interventions with artificial intelligence methodologies.

About the speaker:

Omar Costilla-Reyes is a postdoctoral researcher at the Institute of Medical and Engineering Sciences at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. His interests are in healthcare, artificial intelligence, education, and Latin America. In research, Omar focuses on artificial intelligence and digital health. Omar obtained his Ph.D. from the University of Manchester in England working at the intersection of artificial intelligence healthcare and biometrics. Omar is the founder and president of the Artificial Intelligence Latin American Summit at MIT. The goal of the summit is to incentivize leaders of the Latin American region in government, industry, and academia to invest and develop Artificial Intelligence for social benefit.

Zoom Link: https://miami.zoom.us/j/92978732928

title: Predictive Modeling for Healthcare
description:
Dr. Beverly Festin Martinez is a member of the FSP Biometrics team at Syneos Health.

Dr. Martinez has served the needs of major stakeholders in the healthcare industry at patient-centered/customer-focused organizations. With her PhD in Statistics & Biometry from Emory University and continuing education in analytics, she has contributed to both randomized controlled trials and real-world evidence generation within the therapeutic areas of many disease models.

Dr. Martinez will present an example of prediction modeling (a.k.a. supervised machine learning) using R. This use case will highlight the process flow of applying predictive models in the healthcare space.

title: Gabriela de Queiroz on R-Ladies and Unbiased AI
description:
Join us on SEPT 10th is a collab between R-Ladies SF, AI Inclusive and R-Ladies Miami featuring the Founder of R-Ladies and AI Inclusive Gabriela de Queiroz. Gabriela is a Sr. Engineering and Data Science Manager at IBM.

Connect to hear about Gabriela's journey and her vision for a more balanced world with ethical practices in ML! Use this opportunity to join us on a Firechat to ask her any questions about Data Science and building communities.

Gabriela de Queiroz Bio:

Gabriela de Queiroz is a Sr. Engineering & Data Science Manager at IBM where she manages and leads a team of developers working on Data & AI Open Source projects.
Her team contributes to projects such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Apache Arrow, Apache Spark, and several other open source projects. She works to democratize AI by building tools and launching new open source projects. She is passionate about making data science available to everybody and is actively involved with several organizations to foster an inclusive community.
She is the founder of AI Inclusive (ai-inclusive.org), a global organization that is helping increase the representation and participation of gender minorities in Artificial Intelligence. She is also the founder of R-Ladies (rladies.org), a worldwide organization for promoting diversity in the R community with more than 180 chapters in 50+ countries.

title: Global R-Ladies ‚ö°Ô∏è‚ö°Ô∏èTalks pt.1
description:
The COVID-19 pandemic has separated many of us from our loved ones but has also brought us closer together. It is because of this and the understanding that many womxn and underrepresented may be hindered from giving a talk that we want to propose OUR FIRST ROUND OF LIGHTENING TALKS!
We are completely overwhelmed and grateful for the amount of interest we have received from the GLOBAL R-Ladies community that we are certain that this will just be one of many üòâ.

Format:
12:05 - 12:15 - R-Ladies MIA Intro & Announcements
12:15 - 12:30 - Speaker 1
12:30 - 12:35 - Speaker 1 Q&A
12:35 - 12:55 - Speaker 2
12:55 - 1:00 - Speaker 2 Q&A

This is a great chance for several of us who don't normally have the opportunity to present, who would like more public speaking practice, or just are excited to share so, we kindly ask that you please be respectful and stay mindful of the effort of our speakers, who have courageously volunteered to speak :)

This months fantastic ladies will be speaking on topics that they are excited to share with you!

*Speaker 1*
Edna Mwenda
Education: Bsc. Actuarial Science and statistics | Insurance | Finance | Econ
Data science enthusiast. Believes in Tech for good.

Topic: Applied Survival Analysis using R (beginner friendly...)

The term 'survival analysis' has been used for data involving time to a certain event such as death, onset of a disease or relapse of a condition. Applied survival analysis arises in many areas including biomedical research, epidemiological studies as well as in engineering and finance areas.

*Speaker 2*
Jyoti Bhogal

Topic: Analysis of Covid cases in India.
She will be discussing her data visualization of the COVID cases in her region in India through a Shiny application

title: A Conversation in Racial Algorithmic Bias with Dr. Safiya Umoja Noble
description:
* IN COLLABORATION WITH R-LADIES NEW ORLEANS*
We could not be more thrilled to present an opportunity to chat with best-selling author, Dr. Safiya Umjoa Noble on how algorithms, such as those used in Google searches, are racially biased and how they enable racial and gender subjugation.

Dr. Safiya Umoja Noble is an Associate Professor at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in the Department of Information Studies where she serves as the Co-Director of the UCLA Center for Critical Internet Inquiry. She is the author of a best-selling book on racist and sexist algorithmic bias in commercial search engines, Algorithms of Oppression: How Search Engines Reinforce Racism (NYU Press).

title: Investigating COVID-19 with R: data analysis and simulations
description:
In this presentation we discuss different aspects of COVID-19 modeling in R.

The presentation has significant technical elements, but most of the workflows are generalized and presented in ways that are easy to understand and transfer to other fields.

The presentation has three parts: data analysis, simulations, and framework design.

1. Data analysis (15-20 min)

- Data analysis of data from well known repositories.

- Like, New York Times COVID-19 and Apple COVID-19 Mobility data.

- Application of different data summarizations, visualizations, and machine learning algorithms.

- This is the "warm-up" part of the talk and a fair amount of didactic explanations are given.

2. Simulations (25-30 min)

- Epidemiology models overview.

- Basic compartmental models: SIR, SEI2R.

- Advanced single-site models: SEI2HR-Econ.

- Quarantines modeling.

- Limited resources modeling.

- Interactive interfaces.

- Multi-site modeling and simulations.

- Typical workflows.

3. Framework design (10-15 min)

- This is a more code-technical part that discusses the principles behind the main, novel R packages used in the presentation.

*The Speaker:*
Anton Antonov
Accendo Data, LLC
Senior Research Scientist

Anton is an applied mathematician (PhD) with 28+ years of experience in algorithm development, scientific computing, mathematical modeling, operations research, natural language processing, machine learning, data science, and data mining.

In the last twelve years, he focused on developing machine learning algorithms and workflows for different industries (music, movies, points of interests, recruiting, healthcare.) Currently, he is working on operations research and data science applications to manufacturing and healthcare.

Anton is a former kernel developer of Mathematica.

title: Applications of Natural Language Processing (NLP) in Finance using R & Python
description:
Natural Language Processing is a contemporary topic in a variety of different fields. We will go over some applications of NLP in Finance using R and Python. In this talk, we will provide a framework for assessing different machine learning applications generally and specifically on sentiment analysis. We will then go over a couple of case studies of NLP apps for financial applications; their design, architecture, and how R and Python were leveraged in building them. We will conclude with future extensions, further research, and open it up for Q&A.

The Speaker: ---
Moody is a Group Manager of New Product Development at S&P Global within Market Intelligence, he leads a team focusing on applying modelling techniques, such as machine learning and data sciences to distill information value for risk management based signals. Previously, he was Co-Head of Research and Development at Credit Market Analysis (CMA), where he lead the model development and research on Credit Default Swaps pricing and risk management. Prior to CMA, Moody was a Senior Quantitative Analyst at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange (CME) Group, where we worked on Over-The-Counter (OTC) Clearing of Interest Rate and Credit Derivatives and the SPAN Margining Algorithm. Prior to that he had several senior roles in analytical & technical consulting, spanning diverse areas from Asset-Liability Management (ALM) to Business Intelligence (BI).

Moody holds a Bachelors of Science in Computer Science from Georgia Institute of Technology, Masters of Science in Operations Research from Columbia University and MBA from the University of Chicago ‚Äì Booth School of Business.

title: From Underdogs to Winners
description:
Hello Fam!
We know this time of uncertainty has been challenging for many, particularly those who are just entering the job market or have recently been laid off due to the current pandemic. We want you to know that we are here for you, no matter what. Allow us a moment to relieve any discouragement you may feel and present you with an exciting opportunity to use this time to make yourself stand out from the crowd when things pick back up!

This is why R-Ladies Miami + Women Techmakers Miami has teamed up with Wonsulting to offer you a webinar on how to make yourself marketable in post COVID world, online and offline!

*Zoom link will be sent to ATTENDEES*

About Wonsulting:
Wonsulting was created with one goal in mind: to turn underdogs into winners. Helping those who come from non-traditional backgrounds/non-target schools to get them into their dream careers.

They have conducted 75+ workshops/events at 40+ universities both domestically in the United States and globally in other countries including Canada and Israel. Visit http://www.wonsulting.com for more information!

Our speakers:

*Alice Wu*: A third year student at UC Riverside studying Business Analytics and Applied Statistics. This summer she will start at Intel Corporation as a Business Analytics Intern. In her free time, she loves to workout, cook, volunteer, and travel.

*Jane Zhao*: Jane Zhao works at Indeed as a Client Success Specialist and graduated last year from UCR. Outside of work, you can find her reading books on kindle and working on passion projects related to personal branding.

*Olaseni Adeniji*: A senior computer science student at UDC who is also the president of the National Society of Black Engineers (NSBE). He will begin an internship as a Program Manager at Microsoft .

*Rahul Raghunathan*: A third year Business major at University of California, Riverside, working as a Sales Account Manager for Fresh Prints (a custom apparel company). He will begin as a Summer Analyst for Goldman Sachs. On the side, he works on personal projects related to e-commerce and is currently exploring the digital advertising space as a freelancer. In his free time he loves working out, hanging out with friends, and watching Marvel movies.

*Jason Wendel*: Jason Wendel is a senior, Human Resource Management & Supply Chain Management Major, at Indiana University of Pennsylvania (IUP) with a dynamic passion for professional branding through LinkedIn. Throughout his time at IUP, he has gained valuable leadership experiences such as, being the President of the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) and being a Co-Founder / HR Manager of the American Philanthropic Organization (a student organization that positively impacts the lives of struggling veterans throughout the western Pennsylvania area).

*Roman Lakhnyuk*: A third year business student at University of Alberta in Canada. Roman specializes in sales and marketing, working at Turnip Home as a sales manager and doing contract work for a local home builder running their digital ads. He also holds the position of Partnerships at Wonsulting.

title: "Totally Tidy Tuning Tools" by Max Kuhn
description:
R-Ladies Miami is excited to present Max Kuhn on March 3, 2020!

Many machine learning models have hyperparameters whose values cannot be analytically estimated from the data. For example, the number of neighbors in a nearest-neighbor classification model. The tidymodels collection or R packages are a tidyverse interface to modeling. In this talk, the new tune package will be introduced. Examples of the tidy interface to model tuning will be demonstrated.

Max Kuhn is a software engineer at RStudio. He is currently working on improving R's modeling capabilities. He was a Senior Director of Nonclinical Statistics at Pfizer Global R&D in Connecticut. He was applying models in the pharmaceutical and diagnostic industries for over 18 years. Max has a Ph.D. in Biostatistics.

Max is the author of numerous R packages for techniques in machine learning and reproducible research and is an Associate Editor for the Journal of Statistical Software. He, and Kjell Johnson, wrote the book Applied Predictive Modeling, which won the Ziegel award from the American Statistical Association, which recognizes the best book reviewed in Technometrics in 2015. Their latest book, Feature Engineering and Selection, was published in 2019.

title: Intro to R Markdown
description:
Join us to learn from Co-Organizer, Layla Bouzoubaa, on how to create and prepare R Markdown files within R Studio for presentations and publication ready text, output, and visualizations!

Thanks to our friends at General Assembly Miami for the support! <3

title: rstudio::conf 2020 viewing party üë©üèª‚Äçüíª
description:
Join us as we watch the keynotes from rstudio::conf 2020! We will also be talking about the main takeaways from the conference and what's to come!!

Agenda:
6:30 - 6:45: network & intro
6:45 - 7:30: "Open Source Software for Data Science" J.J. Allaire - Founder & CEO of RStudio
7:35 - 8:30: "Data, Visualization, & Designing with AI" Fernanda Viegas & Martin Wattenburg - Google

See conference details here: https://bit.ly/2FUHULo

title: R + Tableau: Let‚Äôs Enrich Data Science with More Visualizations
description:
Hong Wang, data scientist at Independent Purchasing Cooperative, which is a supply chain management company and provides supply chain service for Subway (US top 2 quick service restaurant brand). The general business is to assure that all Subway restaurants both in US and Canada operate successfully with high quality products and most competitive cost. As a data scientist at IPC, Hong provides in-depth analytical insights and systematic applications, which are both important to improve business. She applies mathematical approaches to solve business questions and enable business stakeholders to make decisions based on my analysis or recommendations.

At IPC, Tableau is used as a reporting application that is able to connect directly to R. The functionality is designed for the domain expert who understands the data and is able to make data science results more visual to broaden audience. The drag-and-drop interface allows users effortlessly connect to libraries and packages, import saved models or write new ones directly into calculations and visualize them in seconds.

title: Tune xgboost with {tidymodels} üë©üèΩ‚Äçüíª
description:
Description: The tidymodels framework is a collection of packages for modeling and machine learning using tidyverse principles. In this meetup, we will walk through a case study from SLICED (the competitive data science streaming show) on predicting Airbnb prices in NYC, and use hands-on live coding to learn how to use tidymodels to tune xgboost models. Come with your questions as we interactively code together and learn about topics like regression modeling, resampling, and model evaluation!

Bio: Julia Silge is a data scientist and software engineer at RStudio PBC where she works on open source modeling tools. She is an author, an international keynote speaker, and a real-world practitioner focusing on data analysis and machine learning practice. Julia loves text analysis, making beautiful charts, and communicating about technical topics with diverse audiences.

title: MACHINE LEARNING & AI MEETUP WEEK
description:
THE MIAMI MACHINE LEARNING & AI MEETUP WEEK WILL GATHER THE COMMUNITY FACE-TO-FACE FROM SEPTEMBER 13-16 TO REVIVE THE ML/AI CONVERSATION IN MIAMI AND SOUTH FL AS WE EMBARK ON NEW AND EXCITING TIMES OF HYPER GROWTH!

Join Data Science Salon, R-Ladies and Tech Hub South Florida for a week of different sessions featuring three evenings put together by local data science community leaders. Expect topics covering, R, Python, Deep Learning, Data Governance, MLOps, Data Science in the Enterprise and much more!

Connect, engage and learn from the local community during the sessions over some beer and pizza, and join the conversation at additional pop-up ML focused gatherings throughout the week, (more to be announced).

The event will be a mixture of onsite/online event.

**For the online event please register at:**
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/miami-machine-learning-ai-hybrid-meetup-week-tickets-162988772807

title: [Webinar] AI Inference Workloads: Solving Challenges Beyond Training Models
description:
Register here: https://info.datascience.salon/ai-inference-workloads-solving-challenges-beyond-training-models

In recent years, enterprise AI initiatives have made great strides in solving the challenges of training massive, distributed computational models. Data wrangling, experimentation management, GPU resource allocation‚Ä¶these challenges have spawned an ever-growing market of new tools and considerable investment. But despite all this, the ability to productize AI is still stunted in most enterprises.

In our survey of more than 200 data scientists and MLOps/IT experts, a majority of AI/ML models still aren‚Äôt making it to production. AI/ML teams are now under pressure to optimize and manage AI inference workloads in production and deliver a return on investment.

In this webinar, we will walk through the distinct characteristics of each stage in the ML lifecycle and their computational requirements. We‚Äôll discuss solutions to improve throughput and reduce latency, and finally, we‚Äôll show how one organization built an efficient inference platform on top of Kubernetes to support their scaling AI initiatives.

‚ÄúRapid AI development is what this is all about for us. What Run:AI helps us do is to move from a company doing pure research, to a company with results in production.‚Äù

Siddharth Sharma, Sr. Research Engineer, Wayve

Register here: https://info.datascience.salon/ai-inference-workloads-solving-challenges-beyond-training-models

title: [Hackathon] - Florida Hacks with IBM
description:
Link: https://floridahackswithibm.bemyapp.com/

Be Part of the Change

Join the University of Florida and IBM in protecting environmental resources and preparing communities for the impact of climate change.
At this hackathon, you and your team will build an application in one of our challenge areas that can change the world using IBM technologies and with support by leaders in technology and climate from University of Florida, IBM, and other partner organizations.

As a hackathon participant, you will be provided with $200 in cloud credits to access to all of IBM‚Äôs services on the cloud.

Challenge #1 - Climate Change & Florida Ecosystem
Challenge #2 - Improving the Condition of Florida‚Äôs Waterways
Challenge #3 - Sustainable Fisheries
Challenge #4 - Power Consumption
Challenge #5 - Animal Agriculture
Challenge #6 - Wildcard

title: Rescuing Coral Reefs with Data Science and Art: Future Pacific
description:
Join us on Thursday for an exclusive presentation and Q&A session with Dr. Nyssa Silbiger on her latest project combining Data Science and Art to rescue coral reefs: Future Pacific. Dr. Silbiger will present the project implementation along with insights on how to perform a scientific study in times of COVID. Furthermore, Dr Silbiger will recount how they translated the study results into an art installation in collaboration with artist Lauren Shapiro.

About the speaker:

Dr. Nyssa Silbiger is currently an Assistant Professor in the Biology Department at California State University, Northridge. She teaches marine ecology, computer modeling and R.

Dr. Nyssa Silbiger uses a diverse set of laboratory, field, and quantitative techniques in her research to understand the impact of climate stressors on organisms, communities, and ecosystem processes in the context of natural variability. To date, she has worked mostly in coastal ecosystems including coral reefs and temperate rocky shores.

You can follow Dr. Silbiger's work at https://nyssasilbiger.com/ and njsilbiger.github.io‚Äã.

title: Growing into R
description:
*SPEAKER:* Dr. Shannon Pileggi

Starting something new in R can be daunting, but there are many community resources that can help! In this presentation, I‚Äôll discuss how I crafted a job interview presentation by making modifications on publicly available TidyTuesday code. This built the technical and confidence-boosting scaffolding I needed for more open-ended projects. The success of this experience inspired me to transition from my role as a consumer and creator to contributor to give back to the R community, which has been incredibly fulfilling. Despite social distancing, I feel more connected to the R community than ever before!

*LOCATION:* ZOOM

title: International Women's Day Conf North America 2022
description:
Hello R-Ladies Miami Fam!!
We invite you to participate one of the biggest IWD celebrations this year hosted by partner, GDG North America!
Theme: #ProgressNotPerfection
This year our theme celebrates all kinds of progress - big or small - and the strength we demonstrate when we don‚Äôt let fear hold us back from following our dreams.

WHY??
‚úÖ Join us in celebrating women's economic, political, and social achievements.
‚úÖ Participate in personal and professional development sessions. [Check out the full schedule and speaker line-up](https://goo.gle/iwd-northamerica22).
‚úÖ Celebrate and share inspiring stories, best practices, and resources with the community

Registering for the event gives you access to our exclusive Slack community with participants all over North America and beyond, speakers, raffle prize opportunities and more!

Share with your networks to join as well - all are welcome!
#IWDNorthAmerica #ProgressNotPerfection #IWD2022
We hope to see you then!

title: WiDS 2022 - South Florida Women in Data Science Conference
description:
We are excited to announce our next WiDS South Florida conference on March 7, 2022. We have great talented speakers from various industry background lined up for this event, so don't forget to register at https://www.wids-sfl.com to join livestream of the conference taking place at the NextEra Energy Headquarters in Juno Beach.

The conference is open to everyone, regardless of gender, who is interested in engaging with and learning from the local data science community.

Speakers will cover various topics : Ethics & Diversity, AI & Workforce Transformations, Data Privacy, AI & Real Estate, Data for Impact. So don't miss it !!!

title: Free 2-Day Scientific Computing with ‚ÄúR‚Äù Workshop 3/3-4
description:
The Institute for Data Science & Computing (IDSC) in collaboration with Software Carpentry bring a free 2 days R workshop.

S[oftware Carpentry](https://software-carpentry.org/) aims to help researchers get their work done in less time and with less pain by teaching them basic research computing skills. This hands-on workshop will cover basic concepts and tools, including program design, version control, data management, and task automation. Participants will be encouraged to help one another and to apply what they have learned to their own research problems.

**Thursday \+ Friday 3/3\-4/22 \| 9:00 AM ‚Äì 4:30 PM Course Hours\, Both Days**
**Registration Now Closed \| [Syllabus](https://gbianchi4.github.io/2022-03-03_UM_Scientific_Computing_R/) \| [Pre-workshop Survey](https://carpentries.typeform.com/to/wi32rS?slug=2022-03-03_UM_Scientific_Computing_R)**

**Who** This workshop is free and open to UM Faculty, Staff, and Students. The course is aimed at graduate students and other researchers.
You don‚Äôt need to have any previous knowledge of the tools that will be presented at the workshop.

**Where** This training will take place online and in-person at the University of Miami Medical Campus, Don Soffer CRC Building, 1120 NW 14th Street, 7th Floor, CTSI Research Training Center (Room), Miami FL 33136. ([Map \| Directions](https://www.google.com/maps/place/1120+NW+14th+St,+Miami,+FL+33136/@25.7870883,-80.2151046,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x88d9b6c128d707fd:0xd2e3c73b592f5d8!8m2!3d25.7870883!4d-80.2129159)) The instructors will provide you with the information you will need to connect to this meeting.
**When** March 3\-4\, 2022 \| 9:00 AM to 4:30 PM [Add to your Google Calendar.](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/render?action=TEMPLATE&text=Software%20Carpentry%20Workshop&dates=20220303/20220305&trp=false&sprop&sprop=name:&sf=true&output=xml&location=online&details=Software%20Carpentry%20Workshop%20at%20University%20of%20Miami)
